head.title: U.S. Must Hear All Sides in Kosovo

hedline.hl1: U.S. Must Hear All Sides in Kosovo

abstract.p: Chip Joyce letter disputes A M Rosenthal's June 19 Op-Ed column condemning Clinton Administration's alleged appeasement of dictatorships like Iran (S)

block.p: A. M. Rosenthal (column, June 19) is right about President Clinton's appeasement of dictatorships as being ''the end of principle'' for United States foreign policy. However, I disagree that the motivation is to increase trade. The real motivation of the President's foreign policy is ''altruism,'' which translates into the sacrifice of American interests to other countries, including our enemies.

A. M. Rosenthal (column, June 19) is right about President Clinton's appeasement of dictatorships as being ''the end of principle'' for United States foreign policy. However, I disagree that the motivation is to increase trade. The real motivation of the President's foreign policy is ''altruism,'' which translates into the sacrifice of American interests to other countries, including our enemies.

Mr. Clinton is eager to dedicate United States troops to peacekeeping missions that serve no American national interest -- for instance, in Bosnia and Rwanda. Also, he generally favors a treaty destructive to the United States: the global warming treaty, if eventually signed by the United States, could force Americans to subsidize underdeveloped countries.
